page.title: 08COWPEN BEWLEY VILLAGE
page.content: Most of{Cowpen Bewley}is farmland which is owned by{I.C.I.}There are two farms and a short terrace of houses facing the road leading to a recently automated level crossing. An attractive village pub is situated at the end of the terrace which hides the beginning of an industrial estate behind them. Several more houses are grouped round the crossroads including a couple of bungalows.There used to be a{Primary {School}in the village which was open until the 1960's but this has been converted into a house which is now occupied by a doctor.Children have to travel in to nearby{Billingham}to attend the local{Primary and {Comprehensive}schools.
